alert.note: Alert for Carroll (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 8:31AM EDT until May 02 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Hampshire...Maine... Saco River At Conway affecting Cumberland, Carroll and Oxford Counties. For the Saco River...including Conway...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saco River at Conway. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Minor flooding occurs as floodwaters reach West Side Road. Much of Transvale Acres floods from Moat Brook Bridge east to the Saco River. Numerous structures become flooded with buildings on campgrounds flooded by several feet. Campers should move to higher grounds. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM EDT Monday the stage was 10.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 AM EDT Monday was 10.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 12.5 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning to 7.4 feet tomorrow evening. It will rise to 7.5 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
